segment.source: Internet Explorer Startup Performance
segment.target: Internet Explorer Startup Performance

segment.source: Internet Explorer Startup Performance
segment.target: Internet Explorer Startup Performance

segment.source: Internet Explorer Startup Performance
segment.target: Internet Explorer Startup Performance

segment.source: The Internet Explorer Startup Performance assessment helps identify components that may affect the time to start Internet Explorer.
segment.target: The Internet Explorer Startup Performance assessment helps identify components that may affect the time to start Internet Explorer.

segment.source: The assessment measures the time to fully render a new Internet Explorer window on the desktop, with a single tab and simple content.
segment.target: The assessment measures the time to fully render a new Internet Explorer window on the desktop, with a single tab and simple content.

segment.source: This measurement includes the load time of the IExplore.exe process and the frame-creation and tab-creation intervals.
segment.target: This measurement includes the load time of the IExplore.exe process and the frame-creation and tab-creation intervals.

segment.source: The assessment also measures the performance of extensions that are loaded and initialized during startup.
segment.target: The assessment also measures the performance of extensions that are loaded and initialized during startup.

segment.source: It doesn't measure network or browsing performance.
segment.target: It doesn't measure network or browsing performance.

segment.source: For more information about results and issues that this assessment produces, see Results for the Internet Explorer Startup Performance Assessment.
segment.target: For more information about results and issues that this assessment produces, see Results for the Internet Explorer Startup Performance Assessment.

segment.source: The assessment follows this workflow:
segment.target: The assessment follows this workflow:

segment.source: Creates a custom local page that notifies you that the assessment is running and instructs you not to interact with the computer
segment.target: Creates a custom local page that notifies you that the assessment is running and instructs you not to interact with the computer

segment.source: Prepares for tracing and metric collection
segment.target: Prepares for tracing and metric collection

segment.source: Starts Internet Explorer and starts to collect metrics
segment.target: Starts Internet Explorer and starts to collect metrics

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The assessment launches Internet Explorer 4 times.
segment.target: The assessment launches Internet Explorer 4 times.

segment.source: The first time is a training iteration, and the next 3 are timing iterations.
segment.target: The first time is a training iteration, and the next 3 are timing iterations.

segment.source: The training iteration ensures that the timing iterations load from the system cache and not a cold start.
segment.target: The training iteration ensures that the timing iterations load from the system cache and not a cold start.

segment.source: The results that are produced are aggregate results from the timing iterations.
segment.target: The results that are produced are aggregate results from the timing iterations.

segment.source: You can change the number of timing iterations in the assessment settings.
segment.target: You can change the number of timing iterations in the assessment settings.

segment.source: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.
segment.target: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.

segment.source: workflow for internet explorer startup performance
segment.target: workflow for internet explorer startup performance

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.
segment.target: The first-run help tips in Windows 8.1 can negatively affect assessment results.

segment.source: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:
segment.target: To disable these, run the following command from an elevated command prompt, and reboot the computer:

segment.source: Run this assessment only while the desktop is full screen.
segment.target: Run this assessment only while the desktop is full screen.

segment.source: Do not run this assessment if you have another Windows Store app opened side-by-side with the desktop.
segment.target: Do not run this assessment if you have another Windows Store app opened side-by-side with the desktop.

segment.source: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:
segment.target: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.
segment.target: Supported architectures include x86-based, x64-based, and ARM-based systems.

segment.source: There are two ways to run this assessment on Windows RT:
segment.target: There are two ways to run this assessment on Windows RT:

segment.source: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console and then run it on Windows RT.
segment.target: Package the assessment job in the Windows Assessment Console and then run it on Windows RT.

segment.source: For more information, see Package a job and run it on another computer.
segment.target: For more information, see Package a job and run it on another computer.

segment.source: Use Windows Assessment Services to run assessments on Windows RT.
segment.target: Use Windows Assessment Services to run assessments on Windows RT.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Assessment Services.

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.
segment.target: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.

segment.source: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.
segment.target: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.

segment.source: You can also customize the settings if you want to gather data that's different from what the assessment captures by default.
segment.target: You can also customize the settings if you want to gather data that's different from what the assessment captures by default.

segment.source: For example, you might identify specific data that can help you perform a detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.
segment.target: For example, you might identify specific data that can help you perform a detailed analysis of a particular aspect of the computer.

segment.source: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended values, and alternative values for each setting.
segment.target: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended values, and alternative values for each setting.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Use recommended settings
segment.target: Use recommended settings

segment.source: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: By default, this check box is selected.
segment.target: By default, this check box is selected.

segment.source: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.
segment.target: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.

segment.source: Iterations
segment.target: Iterations

segment.source: Specifies the number of times that the assessment launches Internet Explorer.
segment.target: Specifies the number of times that the assessment launches Internet Explorer.

segment.source: By default, the value is 4.
segment.target: By default, the value is 4.

segment.source: The first time is always a training iteration, and the next 3 are timing iterations.
segment.target: The first time is always a training iteration, and the next 3 are timing iterations.

segment.source: The training iteration ensures that the timing iterations load from the system cache and not a cold start.
segment.target: The training iteration ensures that the timing iterations load from the system cache and not a cold start.

segment.source: The results that are produced are aggregate results from the timing iterations.
segment.target: The results that are produced are aggregate results from the timing iterations.

segment.source: Use alternate WPR profile
segment.target: Use alternate WPR profile

segment.source: Specifies an alternative Windows® Performance Recorder (WPR) Profile to use.
segment.target: Specifies an alternative Windows® Performance Recorder (WPR) Profile to use.

segment.source: The assessment uses the WPR tool to create a trace.
segment.target: The assessment uses the WPR tool to create a trace.

segment.source: You can use the default profile that is provided or specify a path to a different profile.
segment.target: You can use the default profile that is provided or specify a path to a different profile.

segment.source: To specify an alternative profile, select the Use alternate WPR profile check box, and then type the path in the Path to alternate profile box.
segment.target: To specify an alternative profile, select the Use alternate WPR profile check box, and then type the path in the Path to alternate profile box.

segment.source: You can use the Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) tool to view or analyze the trace file.
segment.target: You can use the Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) tool to view or analyze the trace file.

segment.source: Path to alternate profile (.wprp)
segment.target: Path to alternate profile (.wprp)

segment.source: Specifies the path to an alternate Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) profile.
segment.target: Specifies the path to an alternate Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) profile.

segment.source: This setting is enabled only if you select the Use alternate WPR profile check box.
segment.target: This setting is enabled only if you select the Use alternate WPR profile check box.

segment.source: Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode
segment.target: Enable Minifilter Diagnostic Mode

segment.source: Specifies whether to use the minifilter diagnostic option.
segment.target: Specifies whether to use the minifilter diagnostic option.

segment.source: By default, this check box is cleared.
segment.target: By default, this check box is cleared.

segment.source: When the minifilter diagnostic mode is enabled, it produces metrics that help you evaluate the effect of minifilters on Internet Explorer startup.
segment.target: When the minifilter diagnostic mode is enabled, it produces metrics that help you evaluate the effect of minifilters on Internet Explorer startup.

segment.source: For more information about this setting, see Minifilter Diagnostics.
segment.target: For more information about this setting, see Minifilter Diagnostics.
